title: Prevention of bacterial infections in the newborn by pre-delivery administration of azithromycin
abstractText: The last decade has witnessed an important reduction of the mortality in children less than 5 years of age. Nevertheless, such reduction occurred mainly in children older than 1 month; no change was observed in newborns (between birth and one month of age). Mortality in this age group contributes half of all deaths occurring in children below 5 years of age. Sixteen out of the 20 countries with the highest neonatal mortality are in sub-Saharan Africa. In 1990, the United Nations established the Millennium Development Goals (MDG) aiming at improving by 2015 living conditions of the poorest populations. The MDG number 4 aims at reducing by two-thirds the under-five mortality, a result attainable only with a substantial reduction in neonatal deaths.
